statusColorDescription: Set the color to different status of the room for easy viewing and understanding of the room status at a glance in the "Stay View" screen of the Front Desk login. You can set the color code for 7 room status defined. Simply click on the color block opposite to each status to select the color from the color palette. Save the changes to confirm. You can change the status color any time in future by coming to the same screen.

roomDescriptions.singleRoom: A compact room designed for one person, typically with one single bed. Ideal for solo travelers.
roomDescriptions.doubleRoom: A room designed for two people, usually featuring one large double bed (queen or king size).
roomDescriptions.twinRoom: A room for two people, equipped with two separate single beds. Perfect for friends or colleagues.
roomDescriptions.tripleRoom: A room accommodating three people, typically with a combination of beds like one double and one single, or three single beds.
roomDescriptions.quadrupleRoom: A spacious room designed for four guests, usually featuring two double beds or a mix of beds and bunk beds.
roomDescriptions.familyRoom: A larger room specifically configured to comfortably accommodate families, often with multiple beds or a separate sleeping area for children.
roomDescriptions.connectingRoom: Two individual rooms with a shared internal door, allowing guests to move between them without entering the hallway. Ideal for families or groups.
roomDescriptions.standardRoom: The basic room type in an hotel, offering essential amenities and comfortable accommodation.
roomDescriptions.superiorRoom: A room that is typically larger or offers enhanced amenities compared to a standard room, often with a slightly better view or decor.
roomDescriptions.deluxeRoom: A more luxurious room with premium furnishings, elevated decor, and often a more desirable location within the hotel or a better view.
roomDescriptions.studio: A single-room unit that combines sleeping, living, and often a basic kitchenette area in an open-plan layout.
roomDescriptions.aparthotel: An apartment-style accommodation within a hotel, featuring separate living, sleeping, and kitchen areas. Ideal for extended stays.
roomDescriptions.juniorSuite: A larger room with a designated sitting area that is part of the main room, but not fully separated from the sleeping area.
roomDescriptions.executiveSuite: A suite with a separate living room and bedroom, offering more space and privacy, often with enhanced amenities for business travelers.
roomDescriptions.presidentialSuite: The most luxurious and spacious suite in an hotel, typically featuring multiple bedrooms, a grand living area, dining room, and top-tier amenities.
roomDescriptions.accessibleRoom: A room specifically designed to accommodate guests with disabilities, featuring wider doorways, grab bars, roll-in showers, and other accessibility features.
roomDescriptions.nonSmokingRoom: A room where smoking is strictly prohibited, ensuring a fresh and clean environment for guests.
roomDescriptions.smokingRoom: A room where smoking is permitted. These are becoming increasingly rare.
roomDescriptions.roomWithAView: A room offering a desirable scenic outlook, such as a city skyline, ocean, mountains, or a garden.
roomDescriptions.roomWithoutAView: A more economical room that may have a limited or no specific scenic view, often facing an interior courtyard or another building.
roomDescriptions.cabinRoom: A compact and functional room, often found in budget hotels or hostels, sometimes without a window.
roomDescriptions.villa: A standalone, private accommodation unit, often part of a resort, offering multiple rooms, a kitchen, and sometimes a private pool or garden.
roomDescriptions.bungalow: A small, detached house or cottage, typically with a single story, often found in resort settings.
roomDescriptions.chalet: A wooden house or cottage, often with a sloping roof and wide eaves, typically found in mountainous regions or ski resorts.
roomDescriptions.roomWithBalconyTerrace: A room featuring an outdoor private space, such as a balcony or a ground-floor terrace, offering fresh air and often a view.
roomDescriptions.roomWithJacuzziHotTub: A room that includes a private jacuzzi or hot tub, either indoors or on a private balcony/terrace, for relaxation.
roomDescriptions.hypoallergenicRoom: A room specially prepared to minimize allergens, often featuring air purifiers, special bedding, and non-toxic cleaning products.
